intro: Aiouea brenesii, commonly known as the Brena's aiouea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
